bill_title: provide for legislative oversight of tobacco settlement payments.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to provide for legislative oversight of tobacco settlement payments. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. The tobacco settlement trust fund is established in the state treasury. Any money received from the Master Settlement Agreement signed on November 23, 1998, by the attorneys general of several states and by various tobacco companies shall be deposited in the tobacco settlement trust fund. The principal in the trust fund may not be expended unless the total settlement received is less than one million dollars. The fund shall be invested according to § § 4- 5-23 and 4-5-26. Interest earned on money in the fund shall be deposited in the tobacco settlement interest fund created in section 2 of this Act. Section 2. The tobacco settlement interest fund is established in the state treasury. Interest earned on money in the fund shall be credited to the tobacco settlement interest fund. The money in the tobacco settlement interest fund shall remain in the fund until appropriated by the Legislature. The fund shall be invested according to § § 4-5-23 and 4-5-26. Section 3. There is hereby created the Tobacco Settlement Interest Fund Committee. The Executive Board of the Legislative Research Council shall appoint the membership of the committee, determine the number of committee members, and establish the length of the appointments. Only current, elected members of the Legislature are eligible for appointment. Section 4. Any proposal to spend money from the tobacco settlement interest fund shall first be reviewed by the Tobacco Settlement Interest Fund Committee before the proposal may be submitted to the Legislature for enactment.

action_log.status_text: First read in House and referred to
